contents.contents: Walk down the rue Saint Jean. At the end of it, on your left, you will find the Tithe Barn.

At first, this typical house was not used to store goods. It was the house of a tradesman (there used to be between 150 and 200 of such houses). It was called the Grange of Dimes (the Tithe Barn) later.

question.contents: What was the use of the stones on the fa√ßade?
choices: To serve as perches for birds

explanations.contents: These protruding stones were used to hold awnings that sheltered the tradesmen.
